definition: to receive/to accept/to enjoy/to bring into/to pay (tax etc)/nano- (one billionth)/to reinforce sole of shoes or stockings by close sewing

sentences.english: Fine for delaying payment merges into social insurance fund.
sentences.chinese: 滯納金併入社會保險基金。

sentences.english: A: I don't remember seeing a late fee in the rental agreement.
sentences.chinese: 我不記得租房合同裏提到過滯納金。

sentences.english: B: Remember, just like last month, you have to pay the $50 late fee.
sentences.chinese: 記着，跟上個月一樣，你得交50塊錢的滯納金。

sentences.english: Overdue fine will not be charged on the deferred social insurance premium.
sentences.chinese: 緩繳的社會保險費不計收滯納金。

sentences.english: Pay bills automatically to avoid late fees.
sentences.chinese: 自動化交付肩負所有費用避免滯納金。

sentences.english: I really just want to have these late fees taken care of.
sentences.chinese: 我真的只是想把那些滯納金理理清楚。

sentences.english: Hold over the non-collection of social insurance fines.
sentences.chinese: 緩繳的社會保險費不計收滯納金。

sentences.english: Many card issuers are raising late fees and other charges.
sentences.chinese: 許多信用卡發行機構上調了滯納金和其他收費。

sentences.english: I don't remember seeing a late fee in the rental agreement.
sentences.chinese: 我不記得租房合同裏提到過滯納金。

sentences.english: Remember, just like last month, you have to pay the $50 late fee。
sentences.chinese: 記着，跟上個月一樣，你得交50塊錢的滯納金。
